result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeryale D Goodwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Do not associate with individuals involved in this incident. No contact, directly or indirectly. Must pay any child support obligations currently in effect at the time of release. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless one has already been provided and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Jeryale D Goodwin in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Defendant Jeryale D Goodwin in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. Transcript filed: 01-06-2016 vw.
This is not a Ch. 950 case. Parties have received and reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by the State. Defense puts minor corrections on the record. The State recommends prison.

BTC: Ct 1 - Total sentence is 3 1/2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mos IC, 2 mos ES
         Ct 2 - 1 yr RCJ, conc with Ct 1. May be served in WPS

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA sample if not already provided & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care
FT emp/school
do not associate with individuals involved in this incident. No contact, directly or indirectly
pay any child support obligations currently in effect at time of release

FAW/vote

IS eligible for CIP and SAP
From defendant re: case/concerns with Judge.
From defendent re: new court date/concerns with judge
From defendant re: new court date.
Responding to def re: request for transcripts
From defendant re: move court date up.
Exhibits 11-15
Exhibits 6-10
Exhibits 2-5
Exhibit 1: CD

Ct. 1 - GUILTY.
Ct. 2 - GUILTY.

Defendant Jeryale D Goodwin in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Defendant Jeryale D Goodwin in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Maggie Techert.
Parties have entered into a stipulation-same is put on the record. State is allowed to have Officer Michael Seeger at prosecution table as a representative. Jury enters the courtroom and Oath #2 is given. 
The Court gives the jury preliminary instructions. Opening statements given by the State. Opening statements given by the Defense. The State reads stipulation to the jury. State marks Ex #18-stipulation of parties. Ex #18 moved into evidence/received. The State calls Analyst Laura Hedden - DSAT. Direct by the State. Parties stipulate that witness is qualified to test substances as stated in her report. State marks Ex #16-analyst confidential report. State moves Ex #16 into evicence/received. Cross xam by defense. State calls Officer Juan Garcia - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #15-photo of location of cocaine. State moves Ex #15 into evidence/received and published to the jury. Cross xam by defense. Defense marks Ex #19-TR portion/law. Defense asks the Court to take Judicial notice of the content; the Court takes Judicial notice. Defemse moves Ex #19 into evidence/so received. State calls Officer Bryant Petersen - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by defense.  State calls Officer Juan Mireles - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #2-photo of tint-o-meter, #3-photo of window w/tint-o-meter attached, #4-photo; center console, #5-photo of driver side door, #6-photo front seat, #7-photo of baggie of crack cocaine; #8-photo/closeup w/scale-baggie of crack; #9-photo of baggie w/paper scale; #10-photo-closeup of baggie; #11-photo of center console; #12-photo of blunt; #13-photo-over all driver side; #14-photo of baggies. All exhibits moved into evidence/received-published to jury. Cross xam by defense. State marks Ex #1-DVD of all photos shown. State calls TB - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by defense. State calls JC - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by defense. The State calls Officer Michael Seeger - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #20-Lg bag containing small bags of crack; #21-THC baggie & blunt. State moves #20 & 21 into evidence/received. State marks Ex #22-envelope w/deft's name. State moves #22 into evidence/received & published. State marks Ex #17- copy of Officer Seeger's notes. State moves #17 into evidence/received.  Cross xam by defense. Witness steps down. The State has no further witnesses and rests. Defense moves to dismiss based on lack of evidence. BTC: Motion to dismiss is denied. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to testify and his right to remain silent. The defendant chooses to testify. BTC: The defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently chooses to waive his right to remain silent and chooses to testify. Defense calls JG - DSAT. Direct by the Defense. Cross xam by the State. Defense rests
Parties review JI. The State gives closing arguments. Defense gives closing arguments. State gives rebuttal.

Back on record 5:32.  Clerk, LKH.
Jury Instructions read to jurors.
Alternate juror chosen and excused.
Jurors to deliberate 6:02 pm
Jurors return with verdict.

VERDICT:
Ct. 1, Poss w/ Intent Cocaine:  GUILTY.
Ct. 2, PTHC:  GUILTY.

Jurors polled and excused.
State moves for judgment on verdicts.
State req bond be revoked.
Atty Ekes notes that defendant is in Federal custody.
BTC:  Judgment on verdict is granted.  PSI ordered.  No action taken on bond.

Defendant Jeryale D Goodwin in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Defendant Jeryale D Goodwin in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.
Parties are prepared to proceed. The State puts the final offer on the record. Defense has relayed offer and indicates that defendant rejects the State's offer. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant. BTC: Defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently rejects the State's offer and wishes to go forward with trial. State moves to amend information to 961.41(1m)(cm)2 amending the weight to 5-15g. The State files amended informatin. Defense acknowledges receipt, Amended info is read as to how it will be read to the jury.
Jury enters the courtroom, Oath #1 given. Ms. Tanck-Adams introduces self and members of her office as well as potential witnesses. Mr. Ekes introduces self and his associates along with potential witnesses for the defense. Voir dire by the Court. Voir dire by the State. Voir dire by the defense. Parties exercise peremptory challenges. The jury is chosen. Parties agree on the panel as chosen.

ATTY Ekes files motion to dismiss--lack of probable cause.

Defendant Jeryale D Goodwin in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Defendant Jeryale D Goodwin in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for Jennifer C Tanck-Adams for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that deft was employed at the time he filed the motion and at the time was on federal supervision. Defense indicates that there is a warrant issued by federal court, therefore, the defendant wishes to take care of the federal matter as well as this matter. Defense is facing 24-30 mos in the federal system. Deft will be taken into federal custody if he is released via lower cash bond or signature bond. Defense is asking for lower cash bond of $1000.00 or signature bond to allow him to deal with federal charges. The State strenuously objects - argument put on the record. Defense indicates they are working on a serverance motion as it one of the co-defendant's attorney.

BTC: Request to modify bond is denied

Preliminary hearing on April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
